apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Purchase token for this item. May be used for server-side receipt validation.

apiValue.shortdesc: An integer representing ms since 1970 for the end date of the item, if it is of the SUBSCRIPTION type.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: An integer representing ms since 1970 for the end date of the item, if it is of the SUBSCRIPTION type.

apiValue.shortdesc: An integer representing ms since 1970 for the start date of the item, if it is of the SUBSCRIPTION type.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: An integer representing ms since 1970 for the start date of the item, if it is of the SUBSCRIPTION type.

apiValue.shortdesc: Type of this item - one of AmazonItemData.ENTITLED, AmazonItemData.CONSUMABLE, or AmazonItemData.SUBSCRIPTION

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Type of this item - one of AmazonItemData.ENTITLED, AmazonItemData.CONSUMABLE, or AmazonItemData.SUBSCRIPTION

apiValue.shortdesc: URL to the Small Icon for this Item

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: URL to the Small Icon for this Item

apiValue.shortdesc: Type of this item - one of AmazonItemData.ENTITLED, AmazonItemData.CONSUMABLE, or AmazonItemData.SUBSCRIPTION

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Type of this item - one of AmazonItemData.ENTITLED, AmazonItemData.CONSUMABLE, or AmazonItemData.SUBSCRIPTION

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Dispatched when item data has been loaded in response to a AmazonPurchase.amazonPurchase.loadItemData() call.

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc:
Dispatched when item data has been loaded in response to a AmazonPurchase.amazonPurchase.loadItemData() call.
The itemDatas property of the event will be populated with a Vector of AmazonItemData objects.
If any of the given skus are unavailable, they will be found in the unavailableSkus property.

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Dispatched when a purchase attempt was made for an item with an invalid sku

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Dispatched when a purchase attempt was made for an item with an invalid sku

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Dispatched when a purchase attempt was made for an item that's already owned by the user

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Dispatched when a purchase attempt was made for an item that's already owned by the user

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Dispatched when a purchase attempt has failed

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Dispatched when a purchase attempt has failed

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Dispatched when a purchase attempt has succeeded

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Dispatched when a purchase attempt has succeeded

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Dispatched when the status of purchased Items for the has failed to update

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Dispatched when the status of purchased Items for the has failed to update

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Dispatched when the status of purchased Items has been updated for the user.

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc:
Dispatched when the status of purchased Items has been updated for the user.
This event may be dispatched any time after the SDK is initialized.
If any SKUs have been revoked since the last time the extension was initialized, they will be contained in the revokedSkus property.
If there are any receipts available for currently updated purchases, they will be contained in the receipts property.

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Dispatched After the Amazon Purchase SDK has been initialized by calling AmazonPurchase.create().

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc:
Dispatched After the Amazon Purchase SDK has been initialized by calling AmazonPurchase.create().
The event property 'isSandboxMode' will be TRUE if the app is currently in sandbox/testing mode, or FALSE if the app is currently in production mode (live on the Amazon App Store.)

apiConstructor.shortdesc: Do not call this directly; use AmazonPurchase.create() to initialize or AmazonPurchase.amazonPurchase to get current instance.

apiConstructorDetail.apiDesc: Do not call this directly; use AmazonPurchase.create() to initialize or AmazonPurchase.amazonPurchase to get current instance.

apiException.apiDesc: if AmazonPurchase has already been initialized.

apiReturn.apiDesc: initialized instance of AmazonPurchase extension interface.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Initializes the Amazon Purchase Extension. You should check AmazonPurchase.isSupported() first to ensure the platform is Android; you will also want to avoid instantiating the extension on Android builds not destined for the Amazon App Store. AmazonPurchase is a Singleton and you may have only one instance. After creation, you may access the instance through the static property AmazonPurchase.amazonPurchase.
Any time after creation, AmazonPurchase may dispatch an AmazonPurchaseEvent.PURCHASES_UPDATED event- this will contain an updated list of the user's purchase history for non-consumable content, in its 'receipts' parameter.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Get the current user, if they are logged in to purchase.

apiReturn.apiDesc: the current user id string; otherwise empty string ("").

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Get the current user, if they are logged in to purchase.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Check if running on an Android device.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if the current device supports AmazonPurchase.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Check if running on an Android device. Note that will return true even if the device is not a Kindle Fire.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Retrieve details about a particular item with the given sku.

apiException.apiDesc: the given parameter itemSkus is not a valid Array of strings

apiParam.apiDesc: an array of the String skus for the items to load data about

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Retrieve details about a particular item with the given sku.
After calling loadItemData(), AmazonPurchase will dispatch one of the following events: AmazonPurchaseEvent.ITEM_DATA_LOADED if the data is loaded successfully. The 'itemDatas' property of the evenet will be a vector array of AmazonItemData objects for each given sku. If any skus are no longer available, they will be in the vector array property 'unavilableSkus'. AmazonPurchaseEvent.ITEM_DATA_FAILED if an error occurs loading the item data.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Initiate a purchase attempt for an item with the given Sku.

apiParam.apiDesc: the sku of the item to purchase

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Initiate a purchase attempt for an item with the given Sku.
In response, AmazonPurchase will dispatch one of the following events: AmazonPurchaseEvent.PURCHASE_SUCCEEDED if the purchase is successful. The event's 'receipts' parameter will be a vector array containing an AmazonPurchaseReceipt object for the purchased item. AmazonPurchaseEvent.PURCHASE_FAILED if the purchase was not successful- either due to an error, or the user declining the purchase. AmazonPurchaseEvent.PURCHASE_SKU_INVALID if the given itemSku was not found in the system. AmazonPurchaseEvent.PURCHASE_ALREADY_ENTITLED if the user already owns the particular non-consumable item.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Restores any managed transactions for the current user.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Restores any managed transactions for the current user.
After calling restoreTransactions(), an AmazonPurchaseEvent.PURCHASES_UPDATED event may be dispatched- this will contain an updated list of the user's purchase history for non-consumable content, in its 'receipts' parameter.

apiValue.shortdesc: The current instance of the AmazonPurchase singelton.

apiException.apiDesc: if AmazonPurchase.create() has not yet been called.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The current instance of the AmazonPurchase singelton. You must call AmazonPurchase.create() before this property is available.
